result.title: SkyBitz Introduces the ST705 Radar Monitor: A C1D1, Non-Invasive Solution for Accurate, Real-Time Tank Monitoring
result.text: HERNDON, Va. , Dec. 18, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- SkyBitz, an AMETEK business and a leader in intelligent tank monitoring solutions, today announced the launch of theSmartTank ST705 Radar Monitor, aC1D1-certified, non-invasive, non-contact liquid-level sensor engineered to provide accurate, real-time visibility across fuel, chemical, lubricant, waste oil, and other industrial fluid applications.

result.title: Scottie Resources President Dr. Thomas Mumford Awarded AME'S 2025 H.H. "Spud" Huestis Award for Excellence in Mineral Exploration
result.text: Vancouver, British Columbia--(Newsfile Corp. - December 4, 2025) - Scottie Resources Corp. (TSXV: SCOT) (OTCQB: SCTSF) ("Scottie" or the "Company") is proud to announce that its President, Dr. Thomas Mumford, has been named the recipient of the 2025 Association for Mineral Exploration (AME) H.H. "Spud" Huestis Award for excellence in prospecting and mineral exploration in British Columbia and/or Yukon.

result.title: AMETEK: Shares Are Too Expensive To Justify An Upgrade
result.text: AMETEK remains a high-quality, growth-focused business with strong revenue and profit expansion, driven largely by strategic acquisitions. Despite solid fundamentals and recent acquisitions like FARO Technologies, AME shares are considered too expensive for an upgrade at current levels. Relative valuation shows AME is cheaper than some peers on earnings and cash flow but still lofty on an absolute basis, justifying a "Hold" rating.

result.title: Ametek: Loading Up On Shares Before Earnings
result.text: Ametek, Inc. is rated Buy with a $220 price target, driven by strong secular growth and robust financial flexibility for acquisitions. AME benefits from investments in power generation, pharmaceuticals, aerospace & defense, and US reshoring, supporting accelerated growth and margin expansion. The recent acquisition of Faro Technologies enhances AME's automation and productivity offerings, with management targeting Faro to achieve a 30% EBITDA margin in three years.
